metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9118 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap Buffer Overflow (WRITE of size 4) in function pnmtoimage of convert.c:1719 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: eslerm> in addition to c22cbd8,  may require 2fa0fc6, 784d4d4, and 00f4568 note that 00f4568 is part of 0394f8d

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.2').
